results.title: The French Revolution: the Bastille
results.creator_credit: Jean Becker, Victor Vicas and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Focusing on the fall of the Bastille, shows how a weak, bankrupt king’s efforts to raise money unleashed the first total revolution in history. Amid the extravagance of his court, Louis XVI is warned that he must choose between the demands of the nobility and bourgeoise if he expects to raise taxes in the Estates General. Throughout France, bread is scarce. Mass hunger is inflamed by the aristocrats’ resurgence and by bourgeois talk of equality. When order breaks down in the Paris streets, Louis sides with the nobles and sends troops into the city, and the poor react by turning on that symbol of royal power, the Bastille.

results.title: The French Revolution: death of the old regime
results.creator_credit: George Vicas, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: This film is a combination of live-action scenes with pictorial and sculptural masterpieces of the period. It recreates the chaotic events of the last days of the Old Regime in France. The rebellion of the Third Estate, the storming of the Bastille, the transfer of power from Versailles to Paris. With the establishment of the constitutional monarchy in 1789, the ideals of Liberty, Equality and Fraternity, replaced the “divine rights” and special privileges of the Old Regime. Narrated by Michael Redgrave.

results.title: French from France: to swim like a fish = Nager comme un poisson
results.creator_credit: Michael Style, Donald Carter, Associated Television and Schools Broadcast
results.brief_description: French language training film. Teaches French conversation, at the beach. Two girls sunbathe, swim, meet their friends and play a ball game. Their lively chatter using a wide vocabulary entertains and helps students with pronunciation in a natural way. Script by Jean Pierre Angremy, starring Claude Carroll as Marianne and Francois Apestoguy as Monique and members of the Comedie De L’Quest, Centre Dramatique National.

results.title: Les Devoirs a la maison
results.creator_credit: Michael Style, Donald Carter and Associated Television
results.brief_description: From the series “French from France”, this French language training film teaches students pronunciation of a broad vocabulary in the familiar setting of doing homework. The family all assist Monique in turn, and then her friends call and they all work together on mathematical problems and the theme of an essay. Their discussion of their work repeating key nouns assists in the learning of the vocabulary.

results.title: French explorations in the new world
results.brief_description: With the voyage of Verrazano, in 1524, began the story of France in the New World. Tracing the pattern of exploration through Verrazano, Cartier, Champlain, Marquette, Joliet and La Salle, the film shows how soldier-explorers and missionaries planted the earliest of French settlements and laid the foundations for French strongholds in the New World.

results.title: French children: a farm family in Brittany
results.brief_description: Depicts a farm family living in Brittany. Emphasises family life, showing the work of each member and revealing customs and traditions. Includes scenes in a village school, an old castle and a neighbouring farm.

results.title: French-Canadian children
results.brief_description: A study of the home, school, and community life of a French-Canadian family, showing in particular the influence of the French heritage as it affects speech, manners, and customs.

results.title: Fremantle, first port in Australia
results.creator_credit: Les Bambury and Fremantle Port Authority
results.brief_description: Port facilities at Fremantle, Western Australia. The modern administrative buildings; the port inspection ship “Challenger”; two berth passenger terminal; cargo handling; rail and air terminals. Also some highlights of the port’s history.
results.description: Port facilities at Fremantle, Western Australia. The modern administrative buildings; the port inspection ship “Challenger”; two berth passenger terminal; cargo handling; rail and air terminals. Also some highlights of the port’s history.

results.title: Fremantle cray fishers
results.brief_description: The departure of the cray fishing boats from Fremantle, Western Australia, in the early morning to the fishing grounds in the deep water. These hard working fishermen work a twelve hour day and are dependent on the weather and the mood of the sea for a good season. After the long day they return to port with their catch.

results.title: Friluft: 'The call of the open-air'
results.creator_credit: Jorgen Roos, Dansk Kulturfilm and Minerva Films
results.brief_description: A lighthearted historical cross-section of the open air movement. This film covers outdoor sports/recreation activities throughout Danish history, commenting that Danes first started the scout movement in 1909 and the Youth Hostel movement in 1930 for example. Increasing urbanisation in the cities resulted in society becoming more inward, preferring to stay indoors rather than being sporty as their ancestors once were. As female clothing became freer, along with loosening social mores, people began to go outdoors once more. Chiefly based on original historical material-paintings, engravings, photographs and old films, contrasting with the final live action sequence of present-day. Danish language with English sub-titles. Music by Bent Fabricius-Bjerre and written by Tork Haxthausen.
